thread.title: The alternative candidates who might appear on your voting slip this Thursday

author: Nicole Morley
title: The alternative candidates who might appear on your voting slip this Thursday
text:
The alternative candidates who might appear on your voting slip this Thursday Who will be appearing on your ballot alongside Labour, Conservatives and the Lib Dems? Share The alternative candidates who might appear on your voting slip this Thursday (Image: Newcastle Chronicle) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
As voters head to the polls to cast their ballot on Thursday they’ll notice that some things never change.
The big three political parties in the UK; Labour , Conservative and Lib Dems, are bound to appear on almost everyone’s voting slip.
However, there might be a few unusual parties that voters won’t recognise. Read More
Here’s a roundup of some of the lesser-known parties putting candidates up across Tyneside; Gateshead
Space Navies Party - Blaydon - Lisabela Zxywhiddm Marschild
The Space Navies on their website claim they are an anti-oppression party in the North East. Lisabela has previously stood as a Parliamentary candidate under the party banner ‘We demand a future now’ where she won just 81 votes.
Most of the party’s local election manifesto isn’t publishable here because of libel law, but it’s fair to say she isn’t fan of the current councillors.
Save Us Now - Dunston Hill and Whickham East - Graham Steele
The Save Us Now party is a party of law and order, peace and prosperity and lower taxes, businessman Graham Steele, 58, says.
It also believes that 5G transmitters are being secretly trialled in Gateshead by the Government and that they are making people ill.
Gateshead council have dismissed the conspiracy theories and reassured residents that the street lights in the Borough are not negatively impacting the health of residents. Read More North Tyneside
Renew - Tynemouth - Tom Bailey and Monkseaton South - Alex Jacobs
The newly founded anti-Brexit party has fielded 200 candidates in this year’s local elections, including two in North Tyneside.
Some of the party’s key policies include; aggressive housebuilding, scrapping student loans and a second referendum on Brexit. Newcastle
It’s time to put Newcastle First - Benwell and Scotswood - Adam Mitchell - Callerton and Throckley - William Joseph Jobes - Lemington - Sarah Jane Armstrong and John Alan Gordon - West Fenham - Ian Alfred ose Fraser
Although the party was established in 2011, it won’t be that well known with most voters, especially anyone who has recently moved to the area. The party wants to move away from party politics in Newcastle City Council and say they put communities first. Like us on Facebook
